title: Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice) Recipe
description: This Mexican red rice with garlic and jalapeño is a deliciously savory tomato-flavored rice that makes an authentic side dish for Mexican meals.

Mexican red rice is easy to make and authentic in taste! Use a different chile if you want milder or hotter rice. Submitted by Paulette Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 5 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 2 Roma (plum tomatoes), cored 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 cup minced onion 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 cup uncooked long-grain white rice 1 ¾ cups low-sodium chicken broth ¼ cup canned tomato sauce 1 jalapeno pepper, chopped 2 sprigs fresh cilantro salt to taste Directions Grate tomatoes into a bowl using a box grater; discard tomato skins. Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in rice and cook, stirring often, until rice is lightly toasted, about 3 more minutes. Stir in grated tomato, chicken broth, and tomato sauce; bring mixture to a boil. Stir in jalapeño pepper, cilantro, and salt; reduce heat to low. Cover the skillet and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, about 15 minutes. Do not lift the cover while rice is cooking. Turn off the heat; let rice stand, covered, for 8 minutes. Fluff with a fork before transferring rice to a serving dish. I Made It Print 238 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice) 01 of 14 Photo by  naples34102 02 of 14 Photo by  DREGINEK 05/11/2024 Really liked. Made exactly as written and made to pair with a beef barbacoa recipe from this site. I think the shredding of the Roma tomatoes is a bit unnecessary unless you have a diner who is vehemently opposed to them. I did it but I think if you/your guests like tomatoes, chopping them or adding a can of Rotel works just as well. Could use a little more seasoning like cumin or cayenne but overall, really good take on Spanish or Mexican rice. It’s super easy and allows you to finish other aspects of your meal while this is simmering on the stove. Would make again. Thanks Paulette! 03 of 14 Photo by  PoliteLamb6862 07/01/2022 This was an easy, yummy recipe. I’d never done homemade Spanish or Mexican rice. It was a hit in my house. To save time and a little work, I used a 1/2 cup of canned diced tomatoes instead of fresh grated. I left out the jalapeño because of my toddler, but the tomatoes I used were fire roasted with green chilies and added some great flavor. I’ll definitely be making this again! 04 of 14 Photo by  tlvogelsasktelnet 04/15/2018 05 of 14 Photo by  Lloyd Jones 02/11/2018 06 of 14 Photo by  Cliff G 10/05/2017 Very good recipe! I used peeled Romas and chopped them up worked out great and easy too! Will definitely make again. 07 of 14 Photo by  RainbowJewels 06/22/2017 Made this on a whim to accompany our tacos. It was delicious. I left out the green pepper because I didn't have any. Otherwise made as directed. My whole family loved it, and we agreed it tasted just like the rice at our local authetic Mexican restaurant. This is a keeper! 08 of 14 Photo by  Yoly 05/06/2017 Very good and easy to follow recipe. I left out the Roma tomato only because I forgot to grate it and when I realized this I was to far into the cooking process to stop. Even without the tomato it was still a very delicious and fluffy rice. Will make again. 09 of 14 Photo by  Judie Filipkowski LaBarre 05/31/2016 This recipe has alot of flavor! I will be making this again. I made the Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice) recipe to go with the Chicken Fajita Kabobs recipe I also found on allrecipes.com. 10 of 14 Photo by  Luis Desentis 04/12/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Spanish Rice 18 Ratings Green Rice with Poblano Chiles 1 Rating Better Spanish Rice 47 Ratings Arroz Rojo 17 Ratings Baked Mexican Rice 3 Ratings Spanish Rice II 1,867 Ratings Brown Spanish Rice 23 Ratings Spanish Rice 158 Ratings Quick and Easy Spanish Rice 56 Ratings Mexican Rice with Bell Pepper 1,136 Ratings Linnie's Spanish Rice 156 Ratings Spicy American Spanish Rice 18 Ratings Rice Cooker Spanish Rice 18 Ratings Easy Authentic Spanish Rice 73 Ratings Spanish Brown Rice 36 Ratings Vegan Spanish Rice 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
